Class MXAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.eclipse.mxadapter.MXAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDeploymentAdapter
public class MXAdapter
extends Object
implements IDeploymentAdapter

Adapter to the MX database.

imageMap

private final Map<String,Map<String,org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor>> imageMap
Map used to hold the images for MxUpdate files. The first key is the file extension, the second key the file prefix.

Method Detail

initImageDescriptors

protected void initImageDescriptors()
Initializes the image descriptors read from the plug in properties.

See Also:

connect

public boolean connect()
Connects to the MX database.

Specified by:
connect in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Returns:
true if already connected or connect to MX database was successfully; otherwise false is returned
See Also:
connected, mxContext, checkVersions()

checkVersions

protected void checkVersions()
Checks that the version of the MxUpdate Eclipse Plug-In and the version of the MxUpdate Update Deployment Tool have the same major and minor number within their versions. If not equal the plug-in automatically disconnects from MX.

See Also:
disconnect(), getPlugInVersion(), connect()

getPlugInVersion

protected String getPlugInVersion()
                           throws IOException
Returns for this plug-in the version stored within manifest file.

Returns:
found plug-in version within manifest file
Throws:
IOException - if the manifest file could not found or not opened
See Also:
MANIFEST_FILE

disconnect

public boolean disconnect()
Disconnect from the MX database.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Returns:
true if already disconnected or disconnect from MX database was successfully; otherwise false is returned
See Also:
connected, mxContext

update

public void update(List<org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile> _files,
                   boolean _compile)
Updates given MX update files in the MX database. If PREF_UPDATE_FILE_CONTENT is set, also the file content is transfered within the update (e.g. if an update on another server is done).

Specified by:
update in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_files - MxUpdate file which must be updated
_compile - if true all JPOs are compiled; if false no JPOs are compiled, only an update is done
See Also:
#execMql(CharSequence)

getTypeDefRoot

public ITypeDefRoot getTypeDefRoot()
Evaluates the type tree hierarchy and returns the root. The type definition root is evaluated directly in MX and only converted in the required format.

Specified by:
getTypeDefRoot in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Returns:
root type tree (or null if it could not evaluated)

appendSubNode

protected void appendSubNode(ITypeDefRoot _node,
                             Map<?,?> _treeNode,
                             Map<?,?> _treeMap)
Appends to the _node all required / defined sub nodes.

Parameters:
_node - node where sub nodes must be appended
_treeNode - current tree node which must be appended
_treeMap - map with all tree definitions from MX

search

public List<ISearchItem> search(Set<String> _typeDefList,
                                String _match)
Searches for configuration items within MX.

Specified by:
search in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_typeDefList - list with searched type definitions
_match - string for the names with must match
Returns:
found search items

export

public IExportItem export(org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile _file)
Extract the TCL update code for given _file from MX.

Specified by:
export in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_file - name of the update file for which the TCL update code within MX must be extracted
Returns:

execute

public String execute(CharSequence _command)
               throws matrix.util.MatrixException
Executes given MQL command and returns the trimmed result of the MQL execution. The MX context mxContext is connected to the data base if not already done.

Specified by:
execute in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_command - MQL command to execute
Returns:
trimmed result of the MQL execution
Throws:
matrix.util.MatrixException - if MQL execution fails
See Also:
mxContext, connect()

executeEncoded

protected Map<?,?> executeEncoded(String[] _parameters,
                                  String _method,
                                  Object[] _arguments)
                           throws IOException,
                                  matrix.util.MatrixException,
                                  ClassNotFoundException
Calls given _method in of the MxUpdate eclipse plug-in dispatcher. The MX context mxContext is connected to the database if not already done.

Parameters:
_method - method of the called _jpo
_arguments - list of all parameters for the _jpo which are automatically encoded encoded
Returns:
returned value from the called _jpo
Throws:
IOException - if the parameter could not be encoded
matrix.util.MatrixException - if the called _jpo throws an exception
ClassNotFoundException - if the class which is decoded from the returned string value could not be found
See Also:
mxContext, connect()

encode

protected String encode(Object _object)
                 throws IOException
Encodes given _object to a string with base64.

Parameters:
_object - object to encode
Returns:
encoded string
Throws:
IOException - if encode failed

decode

protected final <T> T decode(String _arg)
                  throws IOException,
                         ClassNotFoundException
Decodes given string value to an object of given type <T>. First the string is base64 decoded, then the object instance is extracted from the decoded bytes via the Java "standard" feature of the ObjectInputStream.

Type Parameters:
T - type of the object which must be decoded
Parameters:
_arg - string argument with encoded instance of <T>
Returns:
decoded object instance of given type <T>
Throws:
IOException - if the value could not be decoded, the decoder stream could not be opened or the argument at given _index is not defined
ClassNotFoundException - if the object itself could not be read from decoder stream
